overview: An original research project will be conducted and a monograph of 5,000 words completed under academic supervision. Preparation for this subject begins in Year 1 when students undertake Healthcare Research: Principles and Designs and new subject Research Project in Human Genomics 1.
Data collection commences in Year 2 and students are required to collect and/or analyse research data, interpret findings and write a monograph to be submitted at the end of Semester 2.
This is supplemented by fortnightly research tutorials, study in existing short courses and other relevant upskilling resources offered by The University of Melbourne.
ilo: Exhibit basic skills in research management
Collect and/or analyse research data and interpret findings
Produce a written description of orginal research suitable for publication and peer review
generic_skills: Ability to convey information clearly in written form

with a minimum grade of H2B (70%) or equivalent

with a minimum grade of H2B (70%) or equivalent

Inherent requirements (core participatio.content: Further details on how to seek academic adjustments can be found on the Student Equity and Disability Support website:http://services.unimelb.edu.au/student-equity/home

assessment.brief: Viva presentation of findings - Semester 2 exam period
Draft conference abstract + 3 minute thesis slide - Semester 1, Week 9
Written monograph 5000 words assessed by 2 examiners chosen by the Board of Examiners (Program Director, Research Coordinator and other senior faculty) - Semester 2, Week 9
Written reflection on research experience (1000 words) - Semester 2, Week 11
Written progress report x3 - Semester 1, Week 3; Semester 1, Week 12; Semester 2, Week 6

date_times.contact_hours: Regular meetings with supervisors, with at least a total of 72 contact hours over the duration of the project. Regular (usually fortnightly) classes facilitated by the Research Curriculum Coordinator, 24 contact hours in total.
